item.title: Australian cricket captain Pat Cummins says he is 'probably unlikely' to play in first Ashes Test
item.description: Pat Cummins all but rules himself out of the first Ashes Test, saying he is still a way short of completing his condensed recovery schedule from a back injury.

item.title: Treasurer announces rework of stalled superannuation tax increase plan
item.description: The government has bowed to pressure on its superannuation tax policy, one of the few revenue-raising measures it had promised, two years on from when it was first announced.

item.title: Carter Gordon rushed back into Wallabies squad after quitting NRL's Titans
item.description: The Wallabies waste no time in welcoming back fly half Carter Gordon to rugby union, less than two hours after it was announced he was leaving the NRL.

item.title: How to tell if your Qantas personal data has hit the dark web and what you can do if it has
item.description: Hackers have released Qantas customer data onto the dark web. Here's what experts say to look out for if you think your personal data may be caught up in the leak and what actions you can take.

item.title: Jesse Southwell signs with Broncos amid fears of lopsided NRLW competition
item.description: NSW State of Origin halfback Jesse Southwell's two-year deal with the Brisbane Broncos may add to the debate about the NRLW's competitiveness since it expanded to 12 teams.

item.title: Government overhauls its proposed superannuation changes
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Corporate watchdog slams superannuation funds on 'customer service', communications with retirees
item.description: ASIC's review of 12 super funds collectively responsible for more $1.2 trillion in member assets finds they are failing in customer service and communications, and may not be giving members information to make informed retirement decisions.

item.title: Australia's best surf lifesaving atheletes begin Iron Series with a re-imagined Gold Coast classic, Coolangatta Gold
item.description: The Coolangatta Gold may have been trimmed down, but the quality of the field sets up an exciting opening round of the 2025/26 Iron Series.

item.title: England provides the blueprint for 2029 Women's Rugby World Cup in Australia
item.description: The recently concluded Women's Rugby World Cup in England took the game to new heights. But, as Alicia Lucas writes, Australia needs to take big strides to ensure its hosting of the tournament in 2029 continues to raise the bar.

item.title: Why Santos is behind your soaring electricity and mortgage costs
item.description: It was a primary force behind Australia’s inflationary surge, it’s forced businesses either to the wall or to shift offshore, undermined national industry policy and resulted in the loss of countless thousands of jobs. And it all hinged on one disastrous decision in an Adelaide boardroom.

item.title: Six NRL players named in England rugby league Ashes sqaud, Man of Steel winner not selected
item.description: Six NRL players are in the England rugby league squad for the upcoming Ashes series against Australia, but there's no room for the most consistent player of the Super League season.

item.title: Alexei Popyrin defeated in ATP Tour Stockholm Open by American Sebastian Korda
item.description: Alexei Popyrin's ATP Tour return has ended with defeat as Australia's second-highest-ranked men's player returns following a back injury.

item.title: Governments announce full details of $102.5m algal bloom summer plan
item.description: Large scale reef restoration, new real-time water monitoring and a $1 million trial of "AI-powered submersible cytobots" are part of a $102.5 million government algal bloom program to ensure "South Australians can enjoy their summer".

item.title: Bridget Archer announces funding for Hobart Clinic
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: WA's flu season exceeds 30,000 cases as authorities blame low vaccination rates
item.description: Western Australia records its worst flu season on record, with more than 30,000 influenza cases reported this year.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: South Sydney Rabbitohs player Tyrone Munro charged with domestic violence offences
item.description: New South Wales Police launched an investigation on Monday after a woman reported she had been assaulted by her partner near Homebush in April 2025.

item.title: An embarrassing backflip by Chalmers on super or a strategic shift?
item.description: After two years of refusing to reshape his superannuation shake-up, the treasurer abandons the idea of taxing unrealised gains while agreeing to index a key tax threshold.

item.title: Why does SA have a summer plan for the algal bloom and what's in it?
item.description: The full details of South Australia's algal bloom summer plan which aims to ensure South Australians can "enjoy their summer" were released yesterday. The plan includes measures to protect the state's coast while supporting businesses and communities.

item.title: Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters pledges no Queensland bias in Ashes series
item.description: Reece Walsh has built a compelling case for selection in the Kangaroos' starting line-up to face England, but coach Kevin Walters says he will not show favouritism towards the Maroons contingent in his squad.

item.title: Roosters NRLW second-rower Aliyah Nasio banned for four matches after grand-final brawl
item.description: The NRLW judiciary adds more pain to the Sydney Roosters' grand-final loss to the Brisbane Broncos, with forward Aliyah Nasio banned for four matches.

item.title: Dying mother loses life insurance after failing to declare UTI tests
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Stuart Broad says Australian cricket team at its 'weakest' ahead of Ashes series against England
item.description: Stuart Broad lights the fuse ahead of the men's Ashes series, saying England has its best chance of winning in Australia since the 2010/11 series.

item.title: Illawarrra Academy of Sport holds open testing day for aspiring young athletes
item.description: Young athletes wanting to be the next Emma McKeon or Jessica Hull have been put through high-performance testing to see if they have what it takes to be a professional.

item.title: England thrashes Latvia 5-0 to qualify for World Cup finals
item.description: Unbeaten in its qualifying matches, England reaches next year's World Cup finals following a dominant 5-0 defeat of Latvia.

item.title: Socceroos lose 2-1 to USA in international friendly, ending Tony Popovic's unbeaten start
item.description: The Socceroos suffer defeat for the first time under Tony Popovic, falling to a 2-1 defeat against the USA in Colorado.

item.title: AFL trade period, deadline day recap: Zach Merrett stuck at Essendon as Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca find new homes
item.description: The clock runs out on deadline day of the AFL trade period, with Hawthorn failing to seal a deal for Zach Merrett, while the Swans hand over a raft of picks to clinch a move for Charlie Curnow.

item.title: Conjoined boys born in PNG bound for Australia for medical treatment
item.description: The boys, who are only the second known case of conjoined twins born in PNG, are expected to come to Australia for medical treatment.

item.title: ARLC says NRL players face 10-year ban for joining rebel leagues
item.description: The Australian Rugby League Commission has announced a 10-year ban for any NRL player who agrees to join a football competition it does not recognise.

item.title: When is the F1 US Grand Prix, how can I watch and who is battling for the championship?
item.description: Formula 1 returns to the United States, officially marking the final quarter of an epic 2025 championship. Here is what is to come.

item.title: How long does it take to acclimatise to a new place when the weather is very different?
item.description: Do our bodies actually acclimatise when moving from one climate to another and can we do anything to smooth the transition?

item.title: David Pye faces murder trial accused of organising Nick Martin assassination at Kwinana Motorplex
item.description: The man accused of organising the assassination of former Rebels boss Nick Martin believed the bikie had also arranged to have him killed, a Perth court hears.

item.title: Boat approaches southern right whales off Albany coast in WA
item.description: The latest close encounter with a protected whale species has renewed calls for the public to give the animals space.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: AFL trade period quick hits: Zach Merrett's agent fumes, clubs feud over Callum Ah Chee deal and Charlie Curnow gets his move
item.description: The AFL trade period's deadline day delivered more drama than ever — with a manager blowing up and a Hawks star suggesting Essendon is 'Alcatraz' on a social media post.

item.title: US wants to make rare earth deals with Australia but without China involved, expert says
item.description: As rare earths re-emerge as a central battleground in the US-China trade war, Australian companies are already striking deals to supply America. A policy expert says talks at the White House next week could secure a national agreement.

item.title: Fifty years since the Balibo Five murders, families are still seeking justice
item.description: On the 50th anniversary of the Balibo Five murders, families are still grieving the loss of their loved ones and remain committed to holding those responsible accountable for their actions.

item.title: What is Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder and how is it diagnosed? Unpacking questions about ADHD
item.description: October marks Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) awareness month and the focus this year is on the many faces of the neurological condition.

item.title: Australians Ajla Tomljanović and James Duckworth reach WTA and ATP quarterfinals in Asia
item.description: Australian duo Ajla Tomljanović and James Duckworth reach the quarterfinals at their respective events in China and Kazakhstan.

item.title: Soldier killed in vehicle rollover during army training in north Queensland
item.description: The Department of Defence says an Australian soldier has died after a single-vehicle rollover during training at the Australian Army's Townsville Field Training Area.

item.title: England saved by rain in Pakistan World Cup match as Australia prepares to face Bangladesh
item.description: Only a rain downpour against Pakistan prevents England from recording its first defeat of the World Cup, as Australia looks to book its berth in knockout stages.

item.title: R360 hits back at Australian Rugby League Commission's threat of 10-year bans for rebel players
item.description: The boss of R360 says threats of 10-year bans for NRL players who defect to the rebel competition are predictable, as the code war escalates.

item.title: Four-time Olympic champion Ariarne Titmus announces retirement
item.description: Ariarne Titmus draws the curtain on a decorated career, in which she won eight medals across two Olympic Games.

item.title: Which team came out the most ahead in the AFL draft period and does free agency need fixing?
item.description: It was one of the more chaotic AFL trade periods on record as picks and players moved all over the place — but who came out ahead the most?

item.title: Police investigating reports of explicit deepfake images of girls from Sydney school
item.description: The ABC understands a number of families attended Eastwood Police Station on Wednesday evening after growing frustrated that a local high school had failed to act on a complaint.

item.title: Australia's unemployment rate jumps to 4.5pc
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate jumped to 4.5 per cent in September, up from 4.3 per cent in August.

item.title: Ariarne Titmus's retirement ends years of sacrifice and allows her to at last savour her greatness
item.description: Ariarne Titmus has given her life to a dream. As she sets off on her next adventures, she can be in no doubt that her years of sacrifice and devotion were worth it.

item.title: Consumer groups, regulator concern as number of Australians accessing super to fix health surges again
item.description: Australians were allowed to withdraw $1.37 billion from their superannuation accounts for medical costs last financial year, in another jump from previous years.

item.title: Assassin who killed Nick Martin at Kwinana Motorplex takes stand in David Pye murder trial
item.description: The man accused of orchestrating the murder of a Perth bikie boss at a suburban speedway did so because of tensions arising from his defection to a rival gang, a court has heard.

item.title: Essendon CEO says Hawthorn AFL trade tactics for Zach Merrett were surprising
item.description: Essendon chief executive Craig Vozzo says the club was surprised Hawthorn waited until late in the AFL trade period to make an offer for their captain, Zach Merrett.

item.title: Mark Haines inquest hears differing opinions from detectives on teen's mysterious death
item.description: Thirty seven years after his death, police still cannot agree on how 17-year-old Mark Haines came to be found on train tracks near Tamworth.

item.title: Ariarne Titmus's greatest races, from Olympic golds, world records and surprise silvers
item.description: The races that made Ariarne Titmus an Australian legend, from her maiden world championships appearance to her perfect Paris farewell.

item.title: Man charged with manslaughter over St James sudden death in Perth's south east
item.description: Homicide squad detectives charge a 33-year-old man with manslaughter over the sudden death of a 25-year-old man in Perth's south-east.

item.title: Thursday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Rugby Championship scrapped for 2026 due to Test calendar squeeze
item.description: The competition will not be played next year but will appear on the global calendar the following three years, including ahead of the 2027 Rugby World Cup, the organisers say.

item.title: Alyssa Healy scores second straight century as Australia qualifies for World Cup semis
item.description: Australian captain Alyssa Healy scores her second straight century as her side maintains its unbeaten record at the cricket World Cup with a 10-wicket win over Bangladesh.

item.title: Calls for Australia to follow England's ban on supermarket junk food specials
item.description: Research finding supermarkets continue to offer discounts and multi-buy deals on junk food more frequently than healthy food prompts calls for Australia to follow England's lead and ban "buy one, get one free" deals.

item.title: More Palestinian prisoners allege mistreatment in Israeli prison system after being reunited with their families
item.description: Shadi Abu Sido spent 18 months in Israeli detention believing that his entire family had been killed in Gaza. Then he was reunited with his wife and children in Gaza.

item.title: Jim Chalmers and Tony Burke are in a long race for prime position
item.description: There is general agreement in Labor that Jim Chalmers is the government's best communicator. But insiders watching this race know Tony Burke is the master tactician.

item.title: Drunken motorcyclist crashes with daughter riding as passenger
item.description: A Mildura father-of-six avoids jail after drunkenly crashing his motorbike while carrying his young daughter as a passenger.

item.title: Warnings for explicit deepfakes, 'image-based abuse' amid rise of AI technology
item.description: A senior academic has warned a Sydney school caught up in an investigation into digitally altered explicit images of female students is just "another shocking iteration" of gendered violence.

item.title: BHP vs China Inc: What the iron ore dispute says about Australia's present and future
item.description: The resolution of negotiations between Australian mining giant BHP and China's state-backed iron ore buyer China Mineral Resources Group could reshape not just the resources industry, but also international trade flows, global markets, and the relationship between China and the West.

item.title: Lucy Derbyshire hunting first Coolangatta Gold win, enters Iron Series as defending champion
item.description: Lucy Derbyshire enters this year's Iron Series as the defending champion and has set her sights on winning the Coolangatta Gold for the first time.

item.title: Zach Merrett trade drama a reminder that deals can no longer be judged by amount of first-round picks involved
item.description: The AFL trade period offered three different test cases on just how much value a first-round pick holds during negotiations. Two stars got their moves, while one was left stranded.

item.title: New research shows impact of lead poisoning on ancient humans
item.description: A new study claims lead might be the reason why Homo sapiens came to dominate the world.

item.title: Dangerous flammable cladding still not removed from dozens of NSW high-rise apartment buildings
item.description: Dozens of high-rise apartment buildings across the state are still covered in flammable cladding as the NSW government's scheme has failed to fix them on schedule.

item.title: Shocking CCTV footage shows moment bus driver assaulted while driving down Darwin highway
item.description: Shocking video footage capturing the moment a bus driver was assaulted, and passengers were thrown through the air, has been played in the NT Supreme Court after the attacker pleaded guilty.

item.title: How a 15yo autistic boy tinkering in his bedroom triggered WA's biggest ever data breach
item.description: Joshua's "passion project" with a radio scanner led to one of WA's most significant public health data breaches. His story highlights the challenges confronting autistic people caught up in the legal system.

item.title: McLaren's 'papaya rules' may be over as Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris battle for the F1 drivers' championship
item.description: "Papaya rules" have dominated Formula 1 for two seasons, but with both McLaren drivers in the heat of a world championship battle, Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris may no longer prioritise what is best for the team.

item.title: Starmer criticises police decision to ban fans of Israel's Maccabi Tel Aviv from Aston Villa match
item.description: Fans of Israel's Maccabi Tel Aviv are banned from attending next month's Europa League match against Aston Villa in Birmingham over "public safety concerns".

item.title: Stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD more evidence Victoria is nation's crime capital, opposition says
item.description: CCTV footage has emerged showing a random stabbing attack in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month. The Victorian opposition says its more evidence of Victoria's standing as the country's 'crime capital.'

item.title: Woman stabbed in Melbourne's CBD in broad daylight
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: SA Education Department fined after teen fell from school playground swing
item.description: South Australia's Education Department has been fined $225,000 after a student at a special school fell from a swing which had not had a comprehensive safety inspection for eight years.

item.title: Defence in talks to support Gaza peace plan but Australia says no request yet
item.description: Australia's defence force has had discussions with the Unted States to provide support for its Gaza peace plan but the government says no formal request has been made yet.

item.title: Virtual emergency department a lifeline for patients in regional areas
item.description: A virtual emergency room app created during the pandemic could help bridge healthcare gaps in regional Victoria. But more patients need to dial-in and use the resource.

item.title: Police renew appeal for information as 'inconsistencies' identified in 2022 death of toddler in Burpengary
item.description: Detectives are renewing calls for witnesses as they investigate the suspicious death of a 16-month-old boy in Burpengary in 2022.

item.title: Pacific Championships set to start without Australia as strong Samoa and Tonga teams take on New Zealand
item.description: Emerging superpowers Samoa and Tonga will field formidable teams loaded with NRL talent in the third edition of the Pacific Championships.

item.title: Broken Hill man wins appeal of sentence for animal cruelty offences
item.description: Jet Jai Johnson is released from prison two-and-a-half months into his 14-month sentence after telling a court spending his 21st birthday behind bars was a wake-up call.

item.title: Cameron Green ruled out of Australia vs India ODI series, Marnus Labuschagne called into squad
item.description: Cameron Green has been ruled out of Australia's ODI series against India, just over a month out from the start of the Ashes series against England.

item.title: Family of murdered Darwin man Tony Rowe describe 'massive hole' of father's absence
item.description: Family members of Tony Rowe — who was murdered on the outskirts of Darwin in 2022 — have read emotional victim impact statements to the court ahead of killer Timothy Hunt's sentencing.

item.title: Australia Test batter Nic Maddinson reveals testicular cancer diagnosis
item.description: Former Australia batter Nic Maddinson has revealed he underwent chemotherapy for testicular cancer.

item.title: David Pye on bail after being refused anxiety drugs in custody, Nick Martin trial hears
item.description: An accused murderer and bikie gang member on trial in WA's Supreme Court amid heightened security is granted bail because he is unable to get access to anti-anxiety medication behind bars, it is revealed.

item.title: Ways to increase safety on a first date and red flags to watch for
item.description: Both people involved in a date are responsible for creating a safe environment, experts say.

item.title: Accused killer Jason Thomas King takes stand in Molendinar landlord Susan Walker's murder trial
item.description: Jason Thomas King has pleaded not guilty to the murder of his landlord Susan Walker on the Gold Coast in 2022.

item.title: Jury finds Za'id Abdus Samad guilty of stabbing murder of uncle outside Brisbane home
item.description: A jury deliberated for one day before finding Za'id Abdus Samad guilty of the stabbing murder of his uncle in a "planned, vicious ambush" in 2017.

item.title: NT DPP confirms it will not appeal sentence for Alice Springs baby assault
item.description: The NT Director of Public Prosecutions has confirmed it will not appeal the non-custodial sentence handed to a young man who fractured the skull of a nine-week-old baby in Alice Springs.

item.title: Grimmer family sets parliamentary privilege deadline for cold case identity
item.description: A brother of three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer, who vanished in 1970, has given the man who confessed to her killing a deadline to come forward or be named.

item.title: Scott Boland bowls Victoria to Sheffield Shield victory over NSW, ahead of Ashes against England
item.description: Scott Boland has produced a man-of-the-match performance, bowling Victoria to a 38-run win over New South Wales in their Sheffield Shield clash.

item.title: AFLW Round 10: Port Adelaide Power defeat Hawthorn Hawks, West Coast Eagles down Geelong Cats
item.description: Port Adelaide defeats Hawthorn to record its fourth win of the AFLW season, while West Coast moves closer to a maiden finals appearance with victory over Geelong.

item.title: Adelaide United defeats Sydney FC 2-1, Brisbane downs Macarthur on A-League Men opening night
item.description: Adelaide United begins its season with a 2-1 win over Sydney, while Brisbane coach Michael Valkanis sees son Dimitri sent off in the Roar's 1-0 defeat of Macarthur.

item.title: Education department admits not enough done to stop Dubbo College Delroy aide harming children
item.description: The NSW government says it should have taken allegations of wrongdoing by a male school staff member more seriously. That failure left those who reported it so isolated their mental health spiralled and never fully recovered.

item.title: Wall Street sell-off could mean hip-pocket relief for millions of Australians
item.description: Australia's big insurance companies were sold off heavily on the share market on Friday after a wave of anxiety hit the sector.

item.description: US President Donald Trump and his family have reportedly amassed hundreds of millions of dollars from cryptocurrencies. Here is what we know.

item.description: Amid growing pressure of his poor start at Nottingham Forest, Ange Postecoglou delivers a five-minute defence of his record as a manager.

item.title: Is the transfer of Australia's best young soccer players a good thing?
item.description: Are A-League soccer fans right to be frustrated when its best young players are sold off, or should they accept it is a 'selling' league?

item.title: James Duckworth returns to ATP Tour semifinal four years after his last
item.description: Four years since he last reached an ATP tournament semifinal in Kazakhstan, Australian James Duckworth is back in the last four at the Almaty Open

item.title: Hospital in the Home program helping young man with agoraphobia who 'cut himself off from the world'
item.description: Tom French's agoraphobia meant he couldn't leave the house to access the mental health care he needed, but a Hospital in the Home program means the care is coming to him.

item.description: From the highly anticipated Bruce Springsteen biopic to a horror movie from the viewpoint of the family pup, here are the films filling up cinemas in October.

item.description: Having developed the program layer by layer since joining the AFLW in 2019, North Melbourne's disciplined, professional style of footy is forcing the rest of the league to rise to their level.

item.description: Alyssa Healy has joined an elite band of women batters with 7,000 international runs, and Australia's captain is giving her brilliant young opening partner something to aim for.

item.description: Former Olympic medallists and a founding member of a platinum-selling band form part of a veteran crew from WA who have set their sights on the world's biggest and most famous rowing race.

item.description: Just last year, the club won the league, and a former president was jailed for stealing $20k. Now they are going to fold.

item.title: Who is Prince Andrew? Why is he giving up his royal title?
item.description: The third-born child of Queen Elizabeth II will still be referred to as a prince and is expected to continue living in his Windsor mansion.

item.title: Kangaroos defeat Crows by 40 points to move closer to winning record as Saints, Dockers and Demons notch victories
item.description: North Melbourne moves one victory away from equalling the all-time VFL/AFL and AFLW winning record with a 40-point drubbing of Adelaide as St Kilda moves closer to a maiden finals appearance.

item.description: A key meeting of the Chinese Communist Party Central Committee is expected to include a major shake-up of President Xi Jinping's inner circle.

item.description: Mason Cox, the first American to become an AFL regular, confirms he will not be with the Magpies in 2026.

item.title: Nottingham Forest sack manager Ange Postecoglou immediately after loss to Chelsea
item.description: Nottingham Forest sacked the winless manager moments after their 3-0 defeat by Chelsea on Saturday local time, which left the club 17th in the standings and on the brink of slipping into the relegation zone.

item.title: Prince Andrew's decision to give up his titles may have been quietly orchestrated by members of his own family
item.description: With the swirl of news around Prince Andrew this week, something had to be done; the question was whether he would do it himself or if his brother would be forced to show him the door.

item.title: Native mussel restoration project supported by Victor Harbor community
item.description: Victor Harbor was one of the first areas affected by SA's harmful algal bloom. Now its citizens are funding and supporting research into rebuilding native mussel populations as it looks to the future.

item.description: Hard Quiz Kids is here again, and we're gifting you a bunch of straightforward questions. Don't embarrass yourself.

item.title: After Ukraine, Finland hopes it won't be Putin's next target
item.description: Blasted into the bedrock, deep below the streets of Helsinki, these massive bunkers are currently used for recreation. Their primary function, however, is much more sinister: preparing for a Russian invasion.

item.title: China's 'special forces'-style tourists packing big itineraries in small budgets
item.description: Young Chinese tourists with limited time and money are travelling 'special forces'-style — inspired by the efficiency, endurance, and intensity of military units.

item.title: How Mother Teresa helped Steve Waugh channel his 'power' for children in need
item.description: When Steve Waugh retired from cricket, he knew he wanted to use his influence to make a difference. It was meeting Mother Teresa that made him realise his new path.

item.title: 'No Kings' protest crowds gather across the US against Donald Trump's leadership
item.description: Organisers say the rallies reflect frustration over the Trump administration's prosecutions of the president's perceived enemies, immigration raids and the sending of troops into US cities.

item.description: Australia's renewable energy push has resulted in a surge in household solar power. But what does that mean for private solar farms?

item.title: Sheffield Shield round two quick hits: Marnus Labuschagne confirms form ahead of Ashes, Scott Boland bullies and spinners offer reminder
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne's magical early season form continues with the bat, Scott Boland and a pair of spinners offer a reminder of their skill, while Sam Konstas turns on the flair at round two of the Sheffield Shield.

item.title: James Duckworth falls at Almaty Open semi-final stage against Daniil Medvedev
item.description: Australian seed-slayer James Duckworth has finally met his match in Almaty, where Daniil Medvedev dug deep to beat him in three sets.

item.title: It's been called Canberra's 'forever government' — but ACT Labor's brand is growing tired
item.description: It's been a year since Canberrans re-elected an ACT Labor government for a seventh consecutive term — but as budget pressures bite, analysts say Labor's stocks are suffering from brand fatigue.

item.title: Mike Hewson creates controversial children's playgrounds. Explore his latest creation
item.description: This designer's "risky playgrounds" are often divisive. His latest is four storeys underground in a former World War II oil tank.

item.title: Social media promotion of raw milk 'misleading and dangerous'
item.description: A public health expert says social media content creators are undermining years of scientific research by promoting raw milk.

item.title: Dodo and iPrimus hack impacts more than 1,600 home internet, email and mobile customers
item.description: More than 1,600 Dodo and iPrimus home internet and mobile customers were impacted by a hack of the telco's email and mobile services, the company confirms.

item.title: GPs with extra skills who want to work in Tasmania say there are no suitable jobs
item.description: Rural generalists are GPs with training in emergency care and one other advanced skill area. While Tasmania has a training program for rural generalists, doctors say their skills are not properly recognised by the Tasmanian Health Service.

item.title: Nationals leader wants Barnaby Joyce to 'stay', amid rumour of One Nation defection
item.description: Announcing he would not re-contest his seat of New England for the Nationals, Barnaby Joyce cited an irreparable breakdown with his party leader David Littleproud. Mr Littleproud says he still wants Mr Joyce to stay.

item.title: National Disruption Group to be established to crush tobacco black market
item.description: A new "National Disruption Group" will be convened to stamp out the exploding illicit tobacco market and other "converging" threats, the home affairs minister has announced.

item.title: Five suspected rat poison cases detected in south-east Queensland
item.description: Queensland Health is investigating after five people were hospitalised with symptoms of ingesting rat poison.

item.title: Ange Postecoglou's Nottingham Forest stint a classic case of wrong place, wrong time
item.description: Ange Postecoglou was on a hiding to nothing at Nottingham Forest, his sacking the result of terrible recruitment and a knee-jerk appointment.

item.title: 'Green bans' saved Sydney's historic buildings and taught economists a lesson
item.description: The "green bans" in the 1970s saved many of Australia's historic buildings and our cities are richer for them. But a famous economist didn't like them.

item.title: Mollie O'Callaghan crushes 200m short course world record as post-Titmus era begins
item.description: Mollie O'Callghan breaks the women's short course 200m freestyle world record on day two of the World Aquatics Swimming World Cup second leg in Illinois.

item.title: More than $6 million of cocaine and methylamphetamine seized during vehicle stop in southern NSW
item.description: Highway patrol stopped the black luxury SUV on a major New South Wales highway for a random drug and alcohol test on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Bulldogs keep finals hopes alive with 66-point Suns trouncing, Lions and Tigers pick up wins
item.description: The Western Bulldogs hammer Gold Coast by 66 points to keep their finals flame flickering, while Brisbane returns to the top four with victory over Essendon.

item.title: Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe wins Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st century
item.description: The results are in — Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe has won Radio National's inaugural Top 100 Books of the 21st Century.

item.title: Hunt for thieves continues after 'priceless' jewellery stolen from Louvre museum in Paris
item.description: The robbers used a basket lift to reach a window where they broke in, France's Interior Minister Laurent Nunez said.

item.title: Australia cruises to seven-wicket victory over India in rain-shortened ODI
item.description: Surviving a series of rain delays in Perth, Australia records a seven-wicket win over India in the first of three men's ODI matches.

item.title: F1 United States Grand Prix: Oscar Piastri's championship lead trimmed, Max Verstappen beats Lando Norris
item.description: Max Verstappen has dominated from pole position to claim his fifth grand prix win of the season, as Oscar Piastri's lead of the Formula 1 drivers' championship was trimmed for the fourth consecutive weekend.

item.title: If AI and crypto aren't bubbles, we could be in big trouble
item.description: Speculative manias where the first investors win because there isn't a bust are rare occurrences.

item.title: Reused signature among string of issues as home owner left with unfinished build
item.description: When Matthew Mapley questioned why the bank had paid his builder for unfinished works, it said it had his written authority — except he hadn't signed it.

item.title: How much do you really know about Australia's epic 65,000-year history?
item.description: First Nations people have survived and thrived through an ice age and massive landscape changes — as well as sharing the land with giant animals.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce says One Nation 'not barking mad' on net zero, but will not reveal if he will defect
item.description: Barnaby Joyce says that, "unlike others", One Nation's approach to climate change is not "barking mad". But the Nationals MP says he remains with his party — for now.

item.title: Anthony Albanese's meeting with Donald Trump could hardly be timed better
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is about to set foot inside the gilded cage of the Oval Office — and the timing could hardly be better.

item.title: Olympic BMX champion Saya Sakakibara still fears racing after brother Kai's horrific crash
item.description: When Saya Sakakibara saw her brother nearly die in a BMX crash, fear took hold. It nearly broke the star siblings' Olympic dream.

item.title: Over a dozen unis are using AI to catch AI — and getting it wrong
item.description: At least a dozen Australian universities are using AI to detect AI. But they're not always catching cheats. Instead, they're wrongly accusing students of academic misconduct.

item.title: 20 per cent HECS cut does not address 'underlying problems', uni students and graduates say
item.description: A 20 per cent reduction on HECS debt is a welcomed relief for some 3 million Australians with a student loan. But those who paid their HECS early or are yet to rack up a debt will miss out on the support.

item.title: Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto has just marked one year in office. Here is what has happened
item.description: A year after Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto won the election, the families of Indonesians arrested in recent protests are expressing dissatisfaction with his leadership.

item.title: Three teenagers injured in attack involving machete outside Luna Park in St Kilda
item.description: Investigators are looking for a group of males who attacked a group of teenagers with a machete outside Luna Park on Sunday evening.

item.title: At Neve's memorial, her good friend Ari Travis gave an impassioned address
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Neve Chapman had a spirited, outgoing demeanour
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Teenager who died by suicide sent final message to Gold Coast health service, but it went unanswered
item.description: The ABC has uncovered the case as part of an examination of Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service's treatment of mental health patients and their suicides.

item.title: Daniil Medvedev wins Almaty Open, Elena Rybakina closes in on WTA Finals
item.description: Daniil Medvedev claims his first ATP Tour tournament win since 2023, while Elena Rybakina's push to reach the WTA Finals gathers momentum.

item.title: ASX closes higher supported by banks while gold stocks sold off, China's economy continues to slow — as it happened
item.description: The ASX gained 0.4 per cent as investors rotated out of miners and gold and into banks.

item.title: All the numbers behind Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st century
item.description: The winner for the Top 100 Books has been announced. What do the votes behind it say about us?

item.title: Healthscope under fire over proposal to farm millions in employees' tax benefits
item.description: In-receivership hospital group Healthscope is taking radical steps to stay alive, converting to a charity and proposing to take up to 90 per cent of a benefit intended to reduce workers' taxable income.

item.title: Israel says ceasefire and aid to resume after airstrikes kill 26 in Gaza
item.description: Israel says it has resumed enforcement of the Gaza ceasefire plan after it was "violated" by Hamas following a wave of Israeli strikes that killed 26 people.

item.title: Multiple sclerosis support group tries to fill gaps as Northern Territory services dwindle
item.description: Being diagnosed with multiple sclerosis can often be an isolating experience, and even more so for those in Darwin who lack access to on-the-ground supports. Despite these barriers, a group of local women have created a support group to help fill the service gap.

item.title: Drone view of Sheikh Radwan in Gaza City.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Drone footage reveals Gaza City's destruction as people return home during ceasefire
item.description: One week into the ceasefire in Gaza, Palestinians are returning to destroyed homes and trying to find shelter.

item.title: England records four-run Women's World Cup win over India to join Australia in semifinals
item.description: England secures its Women's World Cup semifinal spot with a tense four-run win over tournament co-host India at Indor's Holkar Stadium.

item.title: India backs Virat Kohli to rebound after ODI duck against Australia in Perth series opener
item.description: Virat Kohli failed to score in the opening men's ODI in Perth. However, his India teammates expect their ex-skipper to quickly recapture his best form.

item.title: Holiday from Hospital virtual reality to transport patients to Australia's north-west
item.description: A leukaemia survivor designs a VR program that will help patients travel to some of Australia's iconic locations from their hospital beds.

item.title: Richmond is starting to play good footy. But in AFLW's short season there's no time left to build momentum
item.description: After a 0-7 start to the season, Richmond are starting to notch wins on the board. But it's too late for much momentum to build in the short women's season.

item.title: Victorian police minister defends use of rubber bullets, pepper spray at Melbourne protest
item.description: Victoria's police minister backs the police response to protests in Melbourne's CBD on Sunday, when demonstrators were hit with rubber bullets and pepper spray.

item.title: F1 standings: Oscar Piastri says too early for McLaren to prioritise drivers as Max Verstappen continues charge
item.description: Formula 1 championship leader Oscar Piastri says McLaren does not need to prioritise one driver over the other, as four-time world champion Max Verstappen continues to narrow the deficit to both.

item.title: New childcare centres might ease waitlists in regional Victoria, but worker shortages endure
item.description: Hundreds of children in a regional Victorian city are on childcare waitlists, but centres say they cannot open to full capacity as they struggle to find qualified staff.

item.title: Melt Festival is giving queer artists a space to be themselves
item.description: Brisbane's Melt Festival has rapidly expanded in the past decade, inviting numerous venues into the celebration of queer artistry.

item.title: Sam Kerr backed by Matildas coach Joe Montemurro to make impact in friendlies
item.description: Sam Kerr will return to the Matildas fold off the back of limited minutes at Chelsea, but coach Joe Montemurro is confident she will shine.

item.title: What we know about the Louvre jewellery heist
item.description: Here are the details on the items stolen in the Louvre heist that unfolded in broad daylight in Paris.

item.title: Limp Bizkit bandmates pay tribute to bassist Sam Rivers after death at 48
item.description: Fred Durst takes to social media to say he has shed "gallons of tears" since finding out about the death of his "truly wonderful" bandmate.

item.title: Cargo plane slides off runway in Hong Kong killing two airport staff
item.description: The flight arriving from Dubai was landing at Hong Kong International Airport when it skidded off the runway, leading to the deaths of two men in a vehicle on the ground, according to police.

item.title: Australian Olympic champion Kaylee McKeown breaks world short course record
item.description: Australia's five-time Olympic gold medallist Kaylee McKeown sets a world short course record in the women's 200 metres backstroke.

item.title: Deep Time, a story 65,000 years in the making
item.description: ABC's Story Lab team has created an interactive tool to help Australians better understand the ancient history of our continent and its First Nations peoples. Look back at our blog to see how it works.

item.title: Black Swans rowing crew from WA records win at Head of the Charles Regatta in Boston
item.description: A group of West Australian former high-level rowers are still in shock after claiming a win at the world's biggest and most famous rowing event — The Head of the Charles Regatta in Boston.

item.title: Samoa down to 17 fit players after Pacific Championships loss to New Zealand
item.description: Samoa's brutal loss to New Zealand leaves them needing to call fresh troops into their squad, with the Pacific powerhouse down to just 17 fit players.

item.title: Tatiana Dokhotaru told mum she was 'very afraid' of ex-partner before her death, court hears
item.description: Danny Zayat has pleaded not guilty and is facing a Supreme Court trial over the alleged murder of Tatiana Dokhotaru in May 2023.

item.title: Central Land Council CEO Lesley Turner sues senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price over defamation claims
item.description: A seven-day Federal Court defamation case, alleging senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price "trampled" the reputation of an NT land council leader, has begun in Darwin.

item.title: Has Australia just killed its cultural cringe?
item.description: How wonderful for Australian writers to receive this recognition from the very people who consume their work, as part of ABC Radio National's Top 100 Books countdown.

item.title: Election campaign donation laws would have blocked $8m in Climate 200 funding
item.description: Climate 200 would have been blocked from making $8.34 million in donations to independent candidates if new election donation laws were in place at the 2025 poll.

item.title: New England voters divided by Barnaby Joyce's flirtation with One Nation
item.description: Support for the politician remains strong in his electorate despite his apparent flirtation with One Nation, a party enjoying a surge in popularity in the seat of New England.

item.title: Space junk found near WA mine linked to Chinese rocket launch
item.description: Suspected space junk which crashed near an iron ore mine in remote WA has been linked to a Chinese rocket launch.

item.title: Bonza's financial backer 777 Partners co-founder charged with fraud
item.description: The FBI investigation resulted in 777 Partners co-founder Joshua Wander being charged with stealing US$500 million from lenders and investors.

item.title: What will happen to the stolen Louvre jewellery? Experts say it is unlikely they will ever be seen again
item.description: Knowing exactly what they were after, four thieves entered the Louvre Museum and successfully stole precious jewellery. Here's what experts say comes next for the historical items.

item.title: Bushfire concerns for communities in south-east Tasmania ease
item.description: Two bushfire emergency warnings for Nugent in south-east Tasmania have been downgraded, with residents told they can "return with caution".

item.title: Patients at centre of suspected rat poisoning cluster in south-east Queensland are all from Logan. This is what we know
item.description: South-east Queensland authorities are continuing to investigate the source of the cluster, with contact tracing underway.

item.title: Prince Andrew is no longer the Duke of York but will likely remain a prince. Here's why
item.description: The second son of the late Queen Elizabeth II will no longer be called the Duke of York, but he still remains a prince and in the line of succession, despite calls for his remaining title to be stripped. Here's why.

item.title: Mitch Marsh dismisses suggestion he should open for Australia in the first Ashes Test
item.description: Michael Vaughan wants Mitch Marsh opening the batting for Australia in the Ashes but it would require a serious leap of faith from Test selectors.

item.title: Fast and easy dinners for busy weeknights
item.description: Make life easier with some of our simplest dinner recipes, including a 15-minute creamy pasta and air-fryer salmon fillets.

item.title: Voter turnout dips again at 2025 WA Local Government elections amid calls for mandatory voting
item.description: The number of West Australians who voted at the weekend's local government elections is slightly down on previous years, following calls for participation to become mandatory.

item.title: Chinese fighter jet released flares 'very close' to Australian aircraft
item.description: Defence Minister Richard Marles says the incident was "unsafe and unprofessional" and the government has made representations to China.

item.title: John Simmons was convicted of fraud but no one stopped him being a military advocate who ripped off vulnerable veterans
item.description: A convicted "fraudster" has been able to represent vulnerable veterans, scamming them in the process.

item.title: The moment authorities move a piece of space junk that crashed in Western Australia.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Scott Pendlebury launches legal action against former financial adviser over alleged secret withdrawals
item.description: The Collingwood player alleges Jason Sourasis, who helmed A-League club Western United before its collapse, misappropriated more than $2 million over a decade.

item.title: Inquest finds death of Mount Barker man waiting for ambulance 'potentially' preventable
item.description: The cardiac arrest death of a man who waited more than 20 minutes for an ambulance could have been "potentially" prevented if a paramedic had not interfered with the dispatch process and had help arrived sooner, a South Australian coroner has found.

item.title: Amazon cloud unit AWS experiences major global outage disrupting hundreds of platforms
item.description: Amazon's cloud unit AWS has experienced a major global services outage that also disrupted hundreds of other platforms, including Robinhood, Snapchat, Roblox and Perplexity.

item.title: Nashir Hassani forced to pay fine after impersonating security guard at Grand Prix
item.description: Nashir Hassani was fined $4,000 after sneaking into the Formula 1 disguised as a security guard using fake identification and a hi-vis vest.

item.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of detaining scientist ahead of Antarctic conference in Hobart
item.description: A diplomatic row has broken out at an international conservation conference in Hobart after Ukraine accused Russia of detaining one of its scientists for alleged security threats.

item.title: Amazon says outage issue is 'fully mitigated' as sites return to normal— as it happened
item.description: Amazon's cloud unit AWS experienced an outage that also disrupted several other global platforms, affecting customers worldwide — as it happened.

item.title: Advocates accused of exploiting veterans
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Coroner probes death of Alice Springs psychiatric patient who was repeatedly sedated
item.description: NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage is investigating the death of a 33-year-old Alice Springs mother of three who was unable to be revived after repeated medical sedations in 2023.

item.title: Colombia recalls ambassador to the US after Trump announces tariffs increase
item.description: The Colombian foreign ministry said Daniel García-Peña had returned to Bogotá from Washington DC after Donald Trump also announced the US would slash financial assistance to the country.

item.title: Live updates: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump sign multi-billion-dollar minerals deal
item.description: Australia and the United States sign a multi-billion-dollar minerals deal as Anthony Albanese heads to the White House for his first in-person meeting with Donald Trump. Follow live.
